meanings.definition: The action of regaining possession of something, especially when a borrower fails to make payments.
meanings.sent1: After the repossession of the car, the lender sold it to recover the unpaid loan.
meanings.sent2: The repossession of the house happened after months of missed mortgage payments.
meanings.sent3: The repossession of the toy from the child led to a playful chase around the room.
meanings.sent4: Her repossession of the spotlight on stage captivated the audience's attention.
meanings.sent5: The repossession of the lost treasure map brought excitement to the group of friends.

meanings.definition: The act of taking back property or goods due to non-payment.
meanings.sent1: The repossession of the furniture was necessary after the tenant failed to pay rent.
meanings.sent2: The repossession of the electronics store inventory was a last resort for the business owner.
meanings.sent3: The repossession of the stolen cookies from the jar surprised the mischievous child.
meanings.sent4: His repossession of the basketball from the opponent secured the team's victory.
meanings.sent5: The repossession of the overdue library books reminded the student of their forgetfulness.
